channel.description: Recent content in privacy on Reflections

item.title: Hands-On: Mobile AI with Gemma - iOS, Android
item.description: In our previous post, Mobile On-device AI: Smarter, Faster, and Private Apps, we explored the fundamentals of running AI locally on mobile devices â€“ what it is, its advantages, challenges, and the core concepts. Now, it’s time to roll up our sleeves and see this technology in action! This practical guide will walk you through getting hands-on with mobile on-device AI, focusing on how to run Google’s powerful open-weight Gemma model family, including the latest Gemma 3n where supported, on both iOS and Android devices.

item.title: Which browser cares about privacy the most?
item.description: I stopped using Chrome a long time ago due to privacy concerns, and I’ve been switching between Firefox, Edge, and occasionally Brave. But I never spent the time to fully compare these browsers and analyze which one best suits my needs. Today, I decided to look deeply into these browsers and ended up going down a rabbit hole of researching their privacy features. Why is this important? Every time we browse a website, we are sharing bits of our digital life with companies we don’t know.
